match.title: 22nd Match
match.statusText: Australia won by 7 wickets (with 181 balls remaining)

dismissalComment.html: McGrath goes for the lbw inside of the edge, first ball on the stumps, seaming in, Khaled looked pretty plumb in front of middle and off, height have have been a cause for concern by the umpire
Bangladesh showing their inexperience, even undiscovered tribes in Africa knew the next ball would be short into the body, Faruk pushes away, great diving catch by Ponting at point

dismissalText.long: st Khaled Mashud b Minhajul Abedin

dismissalComment.html: two steps down the pitch to the simple medium pace from around the wicket, misses a big pull slog forward of the square leg, simple stumping

headshotImage.longCaption: Mark Waugh player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: priceless stuff, coming down the wicket, missing a ball that drifted a little, Waugh caught of his crease by a good 3-4 metres
bowled around his legs by the left armer coming around the wicket, it certainly takes a special type of batsman to get out like that

headshotImage.longCaption: Terry Alderman player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tom Moody player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Terry Alderman player page headshot cutout 2021

commentTextItems.html: thru the mid wicket, looks heading for a catch, but too high, Australia clean up in style

commentPostTextItems.html: and the crowd stream onto the field, just pre-empting any hint of a good mood from Steve Waugh
Steve Waugh is inaudible over the sounds of the crowd cheering, chanting andbooing. Make up your own cliches folks.
Man of the Big Tom Moody, with his favourite "Fly Emirates" hat on

so Australia trail the West Indies by 0.11 on the net run rate, which, assuming NZ lose to Pak tomorrow, means they have to beat WI by around 15 runs or 3 overs. If NZ win tomorrow, then it will be simply be down to the winner of WI v Aus going thru.
there are some other complications, such as the NZ RR, and what happens if Scotland beat NZ, but that is essentially the situation at the moment.
tomorrow is a 1-match day, NZ v Pakistan. Tune in to see how legs Shoaib Akhtar breaks. Play starts at 945 GMT. Until then, drive safely.

commentTextItems.html: driving thru the mid wicket, that's 50 off an amazing 28 balls
spears it in at his legs, hard back to the bowler, DROPPED!
easily picked off the stumps, about a foot short of being a 6
stands, cover drives, "catch it" was quite the optimistic call
what a slaughter, easily driven thru the covers

commentPostTextItems.html: 14 to win, this will possibly be the last over

headshotImage.caption: Ricky Ponting player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ricky Ponting player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tom Moody player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Terry Alderman player page headshot cutout 2021

commentTextItems.html: pulled in front of square, just fielded in frontof the square leg rope
dancing down the wicket, huge straight drive, over the stumps into the sightscreen
driving down to the wide long on
swung thru the mid wicket, YAB
sweeping hard, the mid wkt fielder dives and slows it down, they get a siungle whilst he regathers
thru the mid wicket, Moody just going the slog, the wide long on fields

headshotImage.caption: Tom Moody player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Terry Alderman player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ricky Ponting player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ricky Ponting player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: down the leg side, the loft over the mdi wicket turns in the a bottom edge to fine leg
swipes over the mid wicket, looks good for a boundary, but Hasibul collects on the 1st bounce
flicking off the legs and behind square
nudged into the covers, one of the more comfortable 3s you'll ever see run, Bangladesh think outfielding isn't fashionable
worked well downthru the mid off
Enamul should get another couple of wickets, he's getting good drift and turn, the perfect weapon for attacking batting

commentTextItems.html: gets it over the backward point, another mishit
pulling, bottom edge behind the body, lucky not to play on

headshotImage.caption: Mark Waugh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mark Waugh player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: priceless stuff, coming down the wicket, missing a ball that drifted a little, Waugh caught of his crease by a good 3-4 metres
bowled around his legs by the left armer coming around the wicket, it certainly takes a special type of batsman to get out like that

headshotImage.caption: Adam Gilchrist  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Adam Gilchrist  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: two steps down the pitch to the simple medium pace from around the wicket, misses a big pull slog forward of the square leg, simple stumping

milestones.description: This is the highest match aggregate (359) involving teams Australia & Bangladesh in ODIs
Akram Khan has broken the record for playing the most ODIs (30) for BAN, going past Aminul Islam
